chargeHist.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit
Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Bukowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and surcharges

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 14 days credit, if revoked.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as follows:  $4,244.33 is payable to Landmark Credit Union and $536.68 to La Chimenea Moore Construction.  To be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Landmark Credit Union, La Chimenea Moore Construction.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion and Agent to determine with or without Non-working hours (Huber).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Failure to Meet Conditions for Expungement filed by DOC.
Judgment/Notice of Entry of Judgment returned.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC

Defendant Anthony J Bukowski in court with attorney Eryn M Menden. Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

9 MONTHS JAIL, w/Standard Release Conditions;(14 days credit if revoked).


TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS; (probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County).

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Landmark Credit Union, La Chimenea Moore Construction;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Perform 100 hours community service. 
*Any other condition deemed appropriate by agent. 

RESTITUTION:  $4244.33 payable to Landmark Credit Union, $536.68 to La Chimenea Moore Construction (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $278.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 30 Days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing at 11-30-2015 10:00 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
